topic.title: zeronet over gnunet
topic.body:
GNUnet is a new network protocol stack for building secure, distributed, and privacy-preserving applications. 

extern link: https://gnunet.org/en/ 

Seems like a promising project. I guess Zeronet is capable to run on top of several p2p-network solutions (tor, i2p, gnunet).

1541537201_1BfSUGhNmbYZHDgLw67nu2b9LbbPn.body:
thunderwave looks cool, but is it easy to clone? 
I really want to have my own small thunderwave-hubs, i think this would be good for decentralization & privacy.

> [glightstar](#comment_107_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): I'm also planning on using the merger/hub function in the new version of ThunderWave. So when I finally have time, I'll get started on it! :)

+1

1552109959_1GDzVsFoYamHqWcYBcuvVWFCAt3Y5.body: bad idea to base that on eth, which is based on a cooperation and quite centralized. seems like smoke and mirrors!

1552879031_1GBAEUig3y3CLL3K5u6GnnMU8y4Ru.body: Should be possible and could be very useful. I guess the yacy instance needs to be detached from a zeronet frontend, because the amount of data of the yacy instance... somehow

1554303010_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body: @leftside : if you managed to clone it: can you make some notes and post it here ?

1554087330_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
- a service to rent a 24/7 0-net node (with a secure vpn-connection) for little money would be great (cheaper than a vserver/ maybe like 1-2$ per month)
- sponsoring/advertisment in collaboration with big youtubers who depend on meme-content (pewdiepie, etc.)
(those youtubers don't want to leave yt, but they need the free flow of memes)

in general: dragging the meme-community into zeronet would be great!

1554477808_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body: those who have nothing to hide cannot be human
